title: Electrical
body: User note:About this chapter: Electrical systems and components are integral to most structures; therefore, it is necessary for the code to address their installation and protection. Structures depend on electricity for the operation of many life safety systems including fire alarm, smoke control and exhaust, fire suppression, fire command and communication systems. Since power supply to these systems is essential, Chapter 27 addresses where standby and emergency power must be provided.

section: Chapter 27 Electrical
title: General

section: Section 2701 General
title: Scope
body: The provisions of this chapter and the Electrical Code shall govern the design, construction, erection and installation of the electrical components, appliances, equipment and systems used in buildings and structures covered by this code. The Electrical Code shall govern the design, installation, alteration, repair, relocation, replacement and addition of electrical components, appliances, or equipment and systems.

section: Chapter 27 Electrical
title: Emergency and Standby Power Systems

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: General
body: Emergency power systems and standby power systems shall comply with Sections 2702.1.1 through 2702.1.8.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Stationary Generators
body: Stationary emergency and standby power generators required by this code shall be listed in accordance with UL 2200.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Fuel-Line Piping Protection
body: Fuel lines supplying a generator set inside a high-rise building shall be separated from areas of the building other than the room the generator is located in by one of the following methods:A fire-resistant pipe-protection system that has been tested in accordance with UL 1489. The system shall be installed as tested and in accordance with the manufacturer's installation instructions, and shall have a rating of not less than 2 hours. Where the building is protected throughout with an automatic sprinkler system installed in accordance with Section 903.3.1.1, the required rating shall be reduced to 1 hour.An assembly that has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 hours. Where the building is protected throughout with an automatic sprinkler system installed in accordance with Section 903.3.1.1, the required fire-resistance rating shall be reduced to 1 hour.Other approved methods.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Installation
body: Emergency power systems and standby power systems required by this code shall be installed in accordance with this code, the Electrical Code, NFPA 70, NFPA 110 and NFPA 111.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Load Transfer
body: Emergency power systems shall automatically provide secondary power within 10 seconds after primary power is lost, unless specified otherwise in this code. Standby power systems shall automatically provide secondary power within 60 seconds after primary power is lost, unless specified otherwise in this code.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Load Duration
body: Emergency power systems and standby power systems shall be designed to provide the required power for a minimum duration of 2 hours without being refueled or recharged, unless specified otherwise in this code.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Uninterruptable Power Source
body: An uninterrupted source of power shall be provided for equipment where required by the manufacturer's instructions, the listing, this code or applicable referenced standards.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Interchangeability
body: Emergency power systems shall be an acceptable alternative for installations that require standby power systems.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Group I-2 Occupancies
body: In Group I-2 occupancies located in flood hazard areas established by the flood plain administrator in accordance with Section 1612.3, where new essential electrical systems are installed, and where new essential electrical system generators are installed, the systems and generators shall be located and installed in accordance with ASCE 24. Where connections for hookup of temporary generators are provided, the connections shall be located at or above the elevation required in ASCE 24.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Where Required
body: Emergency and standby power systems shall be provided where required by Sections 2702.2.1 through 2702.2.19.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Ambulatory Care Facilities
body: Essential electrical systems for ambulatory care facilities shall comply with Section 422.6.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Elevators and Platform Lifts
body: Standby power shall be provided for elevators and platform lifts as required in Sections 1009.4.1, 1009.5, 3003.1, 3007.8 and 3008.8.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Emergency Responder Communication Coverage Systems
body: Standby power shall be provided for in-building 2-way emergency responder communication coverage systems required in Section 918. The standby power supply shall be capable of operating the in-building 2-way emergency responder communication coverage system at 100-percent system operation capacity for a duration of not less than 12 hours.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Emergency Voice/Alarm Communication Systems
body: Standby power shall be provided for emergency voice/alarm communication systems in accordance with NFPA 72.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Exhaust Systems
body: Standby power shall be provided for common exhaust systems for domestic kitchens located in multistory structures as required in Section 505.5 of the Mechanical Code. Standby power shall be provided for common exhaust systems for clothes dryers located in multistory structures as required in Section 504.11 of the Mechanical Code.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Exit Signs
body: Emergency power shall be provided for exit signs as required in Section 1013.6.3. The system shall be capable of powering the required load for a duration of not less than 90 minutes.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Gas Detection System
body: Emergency or standby power shall be provided for gas detection systems in accordance with this code.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Group I-2 Occupancies
body: Essential electrical systems for Group I-2 occupancies shall be in accordance with Section 407.11.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Group I-3 Occupancies
body: Emergency power shall be provided for power-operated doors and locks in Group I-3 occupancies as required in Section 408.4.2.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Hazardous Materials
body: Emergency or standby power shall be provided in occupancies with hazardous materials where required by this code.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: High-Rise Buildings
body: Emergency and standby power shall be provided in high-rise buildings as required in Section 403.4.8.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Hydrogen Fuel Gas Rooms
body: Standby power shall be provided for hydrogen fuel gas rooms as required by this code.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Laboratory Suites
body: Standby or emergency power shall be provided in accordance with Section 415.12.6 where laboratory suites are located above the sixth story above grade plane or located in a story below grade plane.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Means of Egress Illumination
body: Emergency power shall be provided for means of egress illumination as required in Section 1008.3. The system shall be capable of powering the required load for a duration of not less than 90 minutes.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Membrane Structures
body: Standby power shall be provided for auxiliary inflation systems in permanent membrane structures as required in Section 3102.8.2. Standby power shall be provided for a duration of not less than 4 hours.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Semiconductor Fabrication Facilities
body: Emergency power shall be provided for semiconductor fabrication facilities as required in Section 415.11.11.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Smoke Control Systems
body: Standby power shall be provided for smoke control systems as required in Sections 404.7, 909.11, 909.20.7.2 and 909.21.5.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Special Purpose Horizontal Sliding, Accordion or Folding Doors
body: Standby power shall be provided for special purpose horizontal sliding, accordion or folding doors as required in Section 1010.3.3. The standby power supply shall have a capacity to operate not fewer than 50 closing cycles of the door.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Underground Buildings
body: Emergency and standby power shall be provided in underground buildings as required in Section 405.

section: Section 2702 Emergency and Standby Power Systems
title: Critical Circuits
body: Required critical circuits shall be installed and protected in accordance with the Electrical Code and provide a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 hour.

section: Chapter 27 Electrical
title: Electrical Room Signage

section: Chapter 27 Electrical
title: Labeling
body: Doors into electrical control panel rooms shall be marked with a plainly visible and legible sign stating "ELECTRICAL ROOM" or similar approved wording.
